commentary: ellis to rinku singh ,  2 runsshort of a length outside-off , and swiped wide of long-on as rinku pinches two
second_commentary: nathan ellis to rinku singh , 2 runs , length ball , slammed to the left of long-on for a couple of runs  20 runs off the 20 over , india end with a whooping 235 runs

commentary: ellis to rinku singh , four runshelps this past the keeper  opens the face of the bat pretty late at this high-ish full toss , which is wide of off  he just reaches out without any foot movement , playing between wade and short third
second_commentary: nathan ellis to rinku singh , four , full toss outside-off , rinku reaches out and just opens the bat face at the last moment to tickle it between keeper and short third for a boundary

commentary: ellis to tilak varma ,  1 runyorker length , angled in and dipping to finish on sixth stump  jammed to deep-point
second_commentary: nathan ellis to tilak varma , 1 run , wide yorker , dug out towards deep extra-cover

commentary: ellis to tilak varma ,  six runsjust beats the man at deep-point  the fielder moved to his left , but the ball barely went over him  ellis bowled on a length , angling it in but bowling wide of off  tilak presented the full face of the bat , and lofted with little effort
second_commentary: nathan ellis to tilak varma , six , full and quick outside-off , tilak varma slams it over sweeper cover for a six  used a lot of bottom hand power on that one , felt like he might be caught out to the deep fielder but the man could only see it sail over

commentary: ellis to tilak varma ,  six runsjust beats the man at deep-point  the fielder moved to his left , but the ball barely went over him  ellis bowled on a length , angling it in but bowling wide of off  tilak presented the full face of the bat , and lofted with little effort
second_commentary: nathan ellis to tilak varma , wide , slower bouncer , a bit too high

commentary: ellis to tilak varma , 1 widebowls a slower short ball , but it  too high  called first bouncer too , as ellis bowled short and around off , with tilak letting it go
second_commentary: nathan ellis to tilak varma , six , full and quick outside-off , tilak varma slams it over sweeper cover for a six  used a lot of bottom hand power on that one , felt like he might be caught out to the deep fielder but the man could only see it sail over

commentary: ellis to tilak varma , 1 widebowls a slower short ball , but it  too high  called first bouncer too , as ellis bowled short and around off , with tilak letting it go
second_commentary: nathan ellis to tilak varma , wide , slower bouncer , a bit too high

commentary: ellis to gaikwad , outtaken at long-on  another slower ball from ellis , although the length was pretty much ideal for the hoick across the line , and over long-on  but there was little timing there , as the ball went to long-on , where david took it over his head with a reverse cupruturaj gaikwad c david b ellis 58  43b 3x4 2x6 100m  sr: 134 88
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , out caught by tim david   slower delivery , was in the slot but ruturaj couldn't get the desired power on that shot  a big swing across the line but holes out to long-on  gaikwad c tim david b nathan ellis 58 43  [4s-3 6s-2]

commentary: ellis to gaikwad ,  six runsgaikwad joins the fun  six over the bowler  head  a slower ball on a fullish length outside-off , as he gets down early to have a launch with a flat bat
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , six , back of the hand slower delivery , pitches right under ruturaj  bat as he waits for it to arrive and then heaves it down the ground for a straight six

commentary: abbott to rinku singh ,  six runspulled again over deep midwicket  abbott bowls short again , and keeps getting pounded  the ball was banged outside-off , and slammed hard over the boundary
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , six , short ball on leg , rinku pulls it over deep-mid-wicket into the stands  a six to end the over , 25 runs off it

commentary: abbott to rinku singh , four runsmisfield by smith    and four more  should have ideally been a single  the ball was short and ended wide of off , as he swatted hard and far from his body  smith at mid-off failed to grab low , and the ball rolled away
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , four , a misfield and it is steve smith of all people   wonder if he  still reeling from the aftereffects of the world cup win celebration  hard length outside-off , slapped towards mid-off and smith lets it slide between his hands for a boundary

commentary: abbott to rinku singh , four runspulled between deep backward square and deep midwicket  short ball again from abbott - it pitched on middle and moved away towards off - even as there wasn't too much of room for rinku  but he rides the bounce and clubs that
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , four , banged short near the helmet , rinku very easily pulls it away to the right of deep-square into a vacant pocket of the ground for a boundary

commentary: abbott to rinku singh ,  six runslow full toss deposited over the bowler  head  excellently played  he reaches out for this low full toss , which is angling away and ending wide of off  the bat turns in his hands as he lofts away from his body , but the ball travels way beyond
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , six , low full toss , rinku just made a single movement of swinging through the line  didn't move any other muscle and didn't even bother running for that one  such was the conviction in that connection from the southpaw

commentary: abbott to rinku singh , no runshortish ball again , and just outside-off this time  rinku went to slash , but was beaten  the ball seemed to have come on very rapidly there
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , no run , pace off , back of length and angling away  rinku tried to slap it over point but the ball goes over his bat

commentary: abbott to rinku singh , no runshortish ball again , and just outside-off this time  rinku went to slash , but was beaten  the ball seemed to have come on very rapidly there
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , wide , cutter that goes very wide outside-off

commentary: abbott to rinku singh , 1 widevery wide outside leg , as rinku lets this go  this was bowled fuller though
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , no run , pace off , back of length and angling away  rinku tried to slap it over point but the ball goes over his bat

commentary: abbott to rinku singh , 1 widevery wide outside leg , as rinku lets this go  this was bowled fuller though
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , wide , cutter that goes very wide outside-off

commentary: abbott to rinku singh , four runspulled to deep midwicket  the ball is short from abbott , and angling across to end wide of off  but rinku fetches it from there , and finds the gap on the leg-side
second_commentary: abbott to rinku singh , four , length ball on off , pulled hard in front of square and beats the dive of deep-mid-wicket  rinku getting into his groove now

commentary: ellis to gaikwad , no runfull length , and just outside-off , as gaikwad went to heave across the line but was beaten
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , no run , full outside-off , goes under the bat as gaikwad tried a big swing across the line  first sign of that variable bounce we were promised during pitch report

commentary: ellis to rinku singh ,  1 runshort of a length leg-stump , almost cramping him for room  punched to extra-cover
second_commentary: nathan ellis to rinku singh , 1 run , back of length and straight , rinku guides it towards covers for a single

commentary: ellis to suryakumar , outwell taken by stoinis  he moved to his left from extra-cover , all the while looking up at the ball while ending very close to the deep-point fielder  they almost had a mix-up , but stoinis did well in the end  ellis had bowled fullish and pretty wide of off , as surya reached out with a flat bat  but he ended up ballooning it up , beaten by the slower ballsuryakumar yadav c stoinis b ellis 19  10b 0x4 2x6 13m  sr: 190
second_commentary: nathan ellis to suryakumar yadav , out caught by stoinis   gone   end of an entertaining cameo from the indian skipper  smart from ellis to keep it well wide outside-off , beyond the hitting arc and tempting sky to chase it  he gets closer and tries to drive it but toe-ends it in the high  extra-cover runs backwards and completes a safe catch  suryakumar yadav c stoinis b nathan ellis 19 10  [6s-2]

commentary: ellis to suryakumar ,  2 runslofts over mid-on , as ellis bowls another slower ball  but this is on a length around off , with surya spotting the fielder inside the circle
second_commentary: nathan ellis to suryakumar yadav , 2 runs , slower delivery , was pitched up  sky just about lifted it over mid-on for a couple of runs  didn't time it off the middle

commentary: ellis to suryakumar ,  2 runslofts over mid-on , as ellis bowls another slower ball  but this is on a length around off , with surya spotting the fielder inside the circle
second_commentary: nathan ellis to suryakumar yadav , wide , bumper , a bit too high

commentary: ellis to suryakumar , 1 widewide called , but i think this is good bowling  he saw surya step across , and bowled short around off stump  surya let it go , even as the height seemed to be too much
second_commentary: nathan ellis to suryakumar yadav , 2 runs , slower delivery , was pitched up  sky just about lifted it over mid-on for a couple of runs  didn't time it off the middle

commentary: ellis to suryakumar , 1 widewide called , but i think this is good bowling  he saw surya step across , and bowled short around off stump  surya let it go , even as the height seemed to be too much
second_commentary: nathan ellis to suryakumar yadav , wide , bumper , a bit too high

commentary: ellis to gaikwad ,  1 runellis turns around and runs forward , but the ball lands wide in front of him , where an imaginary mid-off fielder would have run forward  short ball from ellis to gaikwad , who looked to pull , but got that off the higher side of the bat
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , 1 run , surprises the batter with a full pace bouncer  ruturaj late on the shot and top-egdes his pull but it falls safe between ellis and extra-cover

commentary: ellis to gaikwad ,  2 runsmisfield by short third to his right , and that allows gaikwad two  that is also his fifty  it was a slower ball on a length on sixth stump , as he slashed behind the wicket
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , 2 runs , pace off , full and wide  ruturaj underedges his cut past the short third fielder who doesn't cover himself in glory with that effort  two runs taken and that  50 for gaikwad , a very controlled knock by the indian opener

commentary: zampa to suryakumar , no runshort of a length just outside-off , and hacked on the bounce to point , where david goes low to his right to grab that
second_commentary: zampa to suryakumar yadav , no run , flat on off , cut towards point  well stopped by tim david

commentary: zampa to suryakumar ,  2 runsshort ball on the stumps , with a hint of turn back in  punched aerially to long-off  left , as they pick two
second_commentary: zampa to suryakumar yadav , 2 runs , flat delivery on middle , punched down the ground and ruturaj had to duck under quickly to avoid a headshot  long-on cuts it off at the expense of a couple

commentary: zampa to suryakumar ,  six runsover the sightscreen  now uses his bottom hand to loft this length ball which is on a stump-to-stump line , only leaning into the shot to grab six more
second_commentary: zampa to suryakumar yadav , six , middle-stump-stump , sky holds his shape and lifts it straight as an arrow over zampa  head onto the sightscreens  six more and nobody is complaining

commentary: zampa to suryakumar , no runsurya also charges down looking to left , but gets an inside-edge on to his back pad as he went to loft at this length ball outside-off
second_commentary: zampa to suryakumar yadav , no run , pitched fuller and was the googly , suryakumar dances out for a big heave but edges it onto his pads

commentary: zampa to gaikwad ,  1 runskips down , with the ball ending up to very full for him on the stumps  flicked wide of long-on
second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , 1 run , dances out and drives towards long-on for a single

commentary: zampa to suryakumar ,  1 runshort of a length , and skids through to middle-stump  punched to extra-cover
second_commentary: zampa to suryakumar yadav , 1 run , darts one through on a length , punched towards mid-off

commentary: stoinis to suryakumar ,  1 runmakes room , but stoinis bowls a sharp short ball which is climbing rather considerably outside-off  surya guides it behind point
second_commentary: stoinis to suryakumar yadav , 1 run , back of length and offering no pace again  sky shuffles away to slash but underedges it towards short third

commentary: stoinis to gaikwad ,  1 runsweeps at this slower ball , which is a dipping , low full toss on middle and off  single to deep-square-leg
second_commentary: stoinis to gaikwad , 1 run , another slower delivery , ends as a low full toss , swept towards deep backward-square-leg

commentary: stoinis to suryakumar ,  1 runthe point fielder dives to his right and gets a hand , as surya hacks at this short ball outside-off  he has to get on top of the bounce of this one
second_commentary: stoinis to suryakumar yadav , 1 run , slower bounce , tapped towards point for a single

commentary: stoinis to suryakumar ,  six runssix in typical surya fashion  uses his wrists to paddle-flick a six over fine-leg , as he gets across the stumps and launches this length ball outside leg
second_commentary: stoinis to suryakumar yadav , six , a first ball six for suryakumar yadav and no prizes for guessing which part of the ground he  hit that towards  a wayward full delivery going down leg , sky shimmies inwards and flicks it over fine-leg like it was the easiest thing to do in the world  what a start

commentary: stoinis to ishan , outalthough he  gone , this looked so much like rishabh pant  he is standing deep in the crease , and throws his hands at a very wide ball - perhaps more than two sets of stumps away - even as he loses his bottom hand and falls on his back  stoinis had bowled on a length , getting it to angle across and finish extremely wide  the ball ended up travelling right to where deep-point was positionedishan kishan c ellis b stoinis 52  32b 3x4 4x6 45m  sr: 162 5see all photos

second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , 1 run , flighted delivery middle-stump , pushed down the ground to long-on

commentary: abbott to gaikwad ,  1 runslower ball , and on a length outside-off  pushed gently to deep-point
second_commentary: abbott to gaikwad , 1 run , short of length on outside-off , gaikwad hangs back and eases it away towards backward-point

commentary: abbott to ishan ,  1 runlands just to the right of short-fine-leg  another short ball from abbott in this over cramps kishan  abbott banged it on the pitch , getting it to land around leg-stump  kishan pulled but for a top edge , with the ball barely landing wide
second_commentary: abbott to ishan kishan , 1 run , falls short of the fielder now  good bowling this from abbott , saw ishan kishan running down the track and dug this in short , cramped him for room and beat for him for pace on the pull , it nearly lobbed up towards short fine-leg off the top-edge , just landed to his right

commentary: abbott to gaikwad ,  1 rundropped by abbott  it was a tough chance though , as he flung his right hand out , with the ball flicking it away  gaikwad just chipped this length ball back with the full face of the bat
second_commentary: abbott to gaikwad , 1 run , half-chance is put down  the umpire had to take cover there , pitched up middle-stump , gaikwad drove that back crisply but it was in the air , abbott stuck his right hand out and got his fingertips to it

commentary: abbott to ishan ,  1 runbangs this on a hard length just outside-off , as kishan pulls to deep midwicket  the ball seemed to be almost rushing on to him there
second_commentary: abbott to ishan kishan , 1 run , short of length on outside-off , ishan kishan pressed back looking to pull it into the stands , went too hard at it and it went towards mid-wicket off the bottom half

commentary: abbott to gaikwad ,  1 runslower ball , and on a length in the channel outside-off  nudged softly to long-on , while almost leaning into the shot
second_commentary: abbott to gaikwad , 1 run , length delivery on outside-off , gently tucked away towards mid-wicket for one

commentary: abbott to gaikwad ,  2 runswell fielded by sangha , as he runs and dives to his right from long-on to cut that off  abbott bowled short around off , as gaikwad played a short-arm pull
second_commentary: abbott to gaikwad , 2 runs , great work in the deep , short of length on outside-off , gaikwad hung back and pulled it away nicely towards cow-corner , david the man at long-on , dived to his right to stop it

commentary: t sangha to ishan , no runshort and wide-ish of off  kishan has a slash , but ends up chopping it on the bounce to wade
second_commentary: sangha to ishan kishan , no run , short of length just outside-off , ishan kishan presses back looking to cut and gets a thick bottom-edge that bounces to the keeper

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad ,  1 runthis is fullish leg-stump , and slower too  turned towards short-fine-leg by gaikwad
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , 1 run , full on leg-stump , gaikwad leans forward and works it away towards deep-square-leg

commentary: t sangha to ishan ,  1 runthis low full toss dips to end up being pretty wide of off , and is dragged to long-off
second_commentary: sangha to ishan kishan , 1 run , floated up full outside-off , ends up being a low full-toss and ishan kishan pushes it down the ground to long-off

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad ,  1 runthis keeps low off a short of a length outside-off , and is swiped to long-on
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , 1 run , length delivery just outside-off , keeps a touch low as gaikwad presses back to drag it down to long-on

commentary: t sangha to ishan ,  1 runpulled on a few bounces to the man at deep backward-square-leg  short again from sangha , getting it to turn into kishan
second_commentary: sangha to ishan kishan , 1 run , dragged down short on middle , ishan kishan presses back and pulls it away , can't beat deep-square-leg though

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad ,  1 runshort outside-off , and turning away yet again  a hard cut to deep-point
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , 1 run , short of length on outside-off , slapped out to sweeper cover

commentary: zampa to ishan , no runsweeps at this wide ball outside leg , which is full and two stumps down  the man at short fine tumbles to his left to cut it off
second_commentary: zampa to ishan kishan , no run , zampa gets away with one , full and down leg , would've been wide but ishan kishan leant in looking to sweep it fine , just couldn't beat short fine-leg

commentary: zampa to gaikwad ,  1 runyorker length on the stumps , and dug out to long-on after getting his front leg out of the way
second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , 1 run , full on leg-stump , pushed down the ground to long-on

commentary: zampa to gaikwad ,  2 runson a short of a length , almost straightening towards middle and off  clipped towards deep midwicket , and they pinch two
second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , 2 runs , good length delivery on middle , bit of extra bounce and gaikwad tucked it away gently towards mid-wicket , went to the edge of the circle and they sprinted back for two

commentary: zampa to ishan ,  1 runfull and flat on off , and nudged to long-on
second_commentary: zampa to ishan kishan , 1 run , middle-stump , pushed down the ground to long-on

commentary: zampa to ishan , no runfull again around off , with a hint of turn away  blocked down , after shaping to almost have a swing at it
second_commentary: zampa to ishan kishan , no run , wrong-un pushed through full on outside-off , ishan kishan prods forward and blocks it solidly

commentary: zampa to ishan , four runsclubs this down the ground  the ball was very full , and just outside-off , as kishan drilled one down between the stumps and the non-striker  zampa stuck his right hand out , but couldn't get a hand
second_commentary: zampa to ishan kishan , four , too full on outside-off , ishan kishan cleared his front-leg and drilled it straight back past the stumps at the other end , no chance for either long-on or long-off

commentary: t sangha to ishan ,  1 runanother one turns in nicely off a short of a length , and finishes around middle and leg  pulled away to fine-leg
second_commentary: sangha to ishan kishan , 1 run , dragged down on outside-off , ishan kishan presses back and pulls it away towards deep-square-leg

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad ,  1 runshort of a length outside-off , and punched to deep-point
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , 1 run , length delivery on outside-off , punched towards deep backward-point off the backfoot

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad , no runfuller length around off , and pushed to cover
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , no run , middle-stump , gaikwad strides forward and pushes it into the off-side

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad , no runah , some turn and sharp bounce  lands this on the shorter side of a length on leg , with the ball ending over the middle-stump , as gaikwad looked to clip but missed
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , no run , oh what a ball  tossed up full on leg-stump , drew him forward , drifted in and then turned away sharply to beat the outside-edge

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad , no runslows it down , and bowls on a length leg-stump  blocked back with his bat and pad close
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , no run , good length delivery on middle-leg , gaikwad prods half forward to defend it

commentary: t sangha to gaikwad ,  2 runssmith at long-on does well to run and slide to his right , and pull this back  the ball was short and turning away to finish around off , as gaikwad pulled between the men at long-on and deep midwicket
second_commentary: sangha to gaikwad , 2 runs , short of length on middle , gaikwad presses right back and pulls it away into the gap at cow-corner , good work from smith , ran to his right from long-on and stopped it with a dive

commentary: ellis to ishan , no runshort of a length just outside-off , and punched down the ground
second_commentary: nathan ellis to ishan kishan , no run , good length delivery on outside-off , ishan kishan hangs back and defends

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , outtaken at short third  from the looks of it , zampa perhaps didn't expect the ball to come on to him that quickly  it was dipping as it approached him , with zampa grabbing it low to his left , and with a reverse cup  this time ellis bowled seam up , angling it across to pitch fullish and wide of off  jaiswal went lofting again , only to mistime it  he lost his right hand off the bat too , with the ball taking the outside edgeyashasvi jaiswal c zampa b ellis 53  25b 9x4 2x6 30m  sr: 212see all photos
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , out caught by zampa   excellent field placement and that  the end of the carnage  jaiswal will be disappointed  was full and just outside-off , jaiswal went hard at this looking to smack it through extra-cover , went at it with all hands and no feet , lost his shape in the process and got a thick outside-edge , zampa was waiting at almost a fly-slip , right on the edge of the circle and he took it over his head  jaiswal walks off to an applause  50 and gone all inside the powerplay  jaiswal c zampa b nathan ellis 53 25  [4s-9 6s-2]

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , outtaken at short third  from the looks of it , zampa perhaps didn't expect the ball to come on to him that quickly  it was dipping as it approached him , with zampa grabbing it low to his left , and with a reverse cup  this time ellis bowled seam up , angling it across to pitch fullish and wide of off  jaiswal went lofting again , only to mistime it  he lost his right hand off the bat too , with the ball taking the outside edgeyashasvi jaiswal c zampa b ellis 53  25b 9x4 2x6 30m  sr: 212see all photos
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , wide , slower delivery full and wide outside-off again , nathan ellis just hasn't hit his mark in this series yet

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , 1 widechange of pace again , but the line is too wide , and the length very full  jaiswal leaves it alone , and it  another wide
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , wide , slower delivery full and wide outside-off again , nathan ellis just hasn't hit his mark in this series yet

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , 1 widechange of pace again , but the line is too wide , and the length very full  jaiswal leaves it alone , and it  another wide
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , wide , slower delivery well wide outside-off , the pressure is telling

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , four runswow , one brilliant shot after another  this is jaiswal  fifty too  now he bisects point and short third , as he helps this short of a length ball in the channel outside-off for four moresee all photos
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , four , brings up fifty in no time  this is jaiswal at his very best  good length delivery angling across just outside-off , he hung back and opened the face to steer it past short-third-man for four more

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , four runsanother four , this time to deep-square-leg  jaiswal smashing all the slowness of the pitch to the boundary  short delivery rising just outside-off , as jaiswal rolls his wrists to pull for four
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , four , crunched  just short of length on middle , jaiswal was very quick to press back and pull it away right into the gap at deep-square-leg

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , four runsflashed to deep-point  this time he got across a step or two , and got this short ball which was wide of off  he waited and cut that hard to the boundary
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , four , to much width , short of length and wide outside-off , jaiswal can free his arms to crash this through point , no chance for any fielder

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , no runah , looks to heave over the off-side at this ball which is on the fuller side of a length , and wide of off , but is beaten
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , no run , full and zipping across outside-off , jaiswal stood his ground looking to slap that through extra-cover and missed

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , no runah , looks to heave over the off-side at this ball which is on the fuller side of a length , and wide of off , but is beaten
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , wide , full and pushed well wide outside-off

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , 1 widebowls wide of off , landing it on a full length  jaiswal lets it go , and it  called wide , although ellis isn't pleased
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , no run , full and zipping across outside-off , jaiswal stood his ground looking to slap that through extra-cover and missed

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , 1 widebowls wide of off , landing it on a full length  jaiswal lets it go , and it  called wide , although ellis isn't pleased
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , wide , full and pushed well wide outside-off

commentary: zampa to gaikwad , no runmakes room , and zampa follows  he bowls short , getting it to come into gaikwad and finish outside leg  punched to the man at extra-cover
second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , no run , flatter delivery going on with the arm on leg-stump , gaikwad backed away a long way before punching it towards extra-cover

commentary: zampa to jaiswal ,  1 runnudges this full ball on his pads to long-on , with this being the wrong 'un from zampa
second_commentary: zampa to jaiswal , 1 run , full on leg-stump , clipped away towards mid-wicket

commentary: zampa to jaiswal , four runswhipped wide of long-on  terrific timing there  the ball is full on a stump-to-stump line , but jaiswal places it beautifully to deep midwicket
second_commentary: zampa to jaiswal , four , wow what timing  tossed up full on leg-stump , was nothing more than a crisp flick , he picked the gap at cow-corner and he timed it to perfection , the outfield did the rest

commentary: zampa to gaikwad ,  1 runanother low full on the stumps , and pushed to long-off
second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , 1 run , very middle-stump , gaikwad makes a bit of room and jams it down to long-off

commentary: zampa to gaikwad , no runvery outside-off , and dug out to cover
second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , no run , pushed up very full on outside-off , gaikwad digs it out towards cover

commentary: zampa to gaikwad , four runsthe shot of the day  there isn't that much of pace to deal with , yet gaikwad deals with this fullish ball so effortlessly to loft it over the bowler  head after standing while backing away
second_commentary: zampa to gaikwad , four , strike bowler or not , it doesn't matter  tossed up middle-stump , right in the slot for gaikwad and he got under it and lofted it straight back over the bowler for one-bounce four

commentary: abbott to jaiswal , no runah , the over ends with a dot , and both abbott and i get a breather  this was bowled very full around off , as jaiswal drove it to mid-off
second_commentary: abbott to jaiswal , no run , full on outside-off , jaiswal stands his ground and smacks it straight to mid-off  massive over for india , 24 runs off it

commentary: abbott to jaiswal ,  six runsthe change of angle doesn't make any difference  this good-length ball was angled into the left-hander , and finished around off stump  jaiswal again shifted his weight back to have a go at the pull short , just clearing the rope at deep-square-leg
second_commentary: abbott to jaiswal , six , superb batting from jaiswal  abbott went round the wicket , dug it into leg-stump but it sat up again , jaiswal hung back and heaved it away into the gap at deep-mid-wicket again for another six , just went over the ropes , 50-run stand too

commentary: abbott to jaiswal ,  six runsflung away over deep-square-leg  that went quite deep into the crowd too  another short delivery around middle and off , as jaiswal transfers his weight to the back foot to pull hard and over the boundary
second_commentary: abbott to jaiswal , six , 4 , 4 , 4 , 6   abbott under pressure now , short of length delivery on middle , jaiswal seemingly knew exactly what was coming , he pressed back and smacked this away over deep-mid-wicket with a pull

commentary: abbott to jaiswal , four runsthe best of the three  a delightful guide to short third  left , as he reads this shortish ball just outside-off to play it as late as possible
second_commentary: abbott to jaiswal , four , this is brilliant from jaiswal , he knew this was going to be pace on , was a hard length delivery on outside-off , jaiswal hung back and used the pace to run it past short-third-man for four

commentary: abbott to jaiswal , four runsfour more in the same region  abbott repeats the trick of a change of pace , and also bowls on a shortish length outside-off  this time though the ball kept a bit low , even as jaiswal slashed it to deep backward-point
second_commentary: abbott to jaiswal , four , back to back fours  very similar delivery , on a length just outside-off , looked like a cutter and jaiswal hung back and waited for it again before smacking it hard past backward-point again

commentary: abbott to jaiswal , four runshacked to deep backward-point  slower ball right away from abbott - it was on a short of a length , and around sixth stump - as jaiswal late-cut it to just beat backward-point to his left
second_commentary: abbott to jaiswal , four , short of length and slanting across just outside-off , just a bit of room on offer , jaiswal hung back and waited for it before slashing it away hard past backward-point

commentary: maxwell to gaikwad , four runsnow gaikwad drills one through to deep-point  like jaiswal , he too stands after backing away , and gets this pretty full ball outside-off to target  he outside-off , with the ball rolling away rather rapidly
second_commentary: maxwell to gaikwad , four , gaikwad doesn't want to be left behind  full just outside-off , gaikwad backed away to make some room before carving that away through cover for four

commentary: maxwell to jaiswal ,  1 runpretty full now around off , and driven down to long-off
second_commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , 1 run , full on outside-off , driven out towards wide long-off

commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , no runshort of a length outside-off , and pushed to cover
second_commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , no run , length delivery on outside-off , jaiswal hangs back and defends it into the off-side

commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , four runsslog swept to deep backward-square-leg  another full delivery outside-off , as he gets down to have a free swing over the in-field
second_commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , four , jaiswal on the charge here  middle-stump , jaiswal leant forward and slog-swept it towards deep-mid-wicket

commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , no runah , some slow turn there  on a full length outside-off , and beats the outside-edge as he looked to defend
second_commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , no run , oh well bowled  tossed up middle-stump , drew him forward , drifted in and turned away to beat the outside-edge

commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , four runsgoes inside out over cover  stands after making some room at this full ball dipping just outside-off - for a while it seemed to be too full for that shot - and opens the bat face to loft for four
second_commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , four , superb shot  tossed up full on outside-off , jaiswal stepped forward , got to the pitch and played a cracking lofted extra-cover-drive , no one out on the off-side and away it went

commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , four runsgoes inside out over cover  stands after making some room at this full ball dipping just outside-off - for a while it seemed to be too full for that shot - and opens the bat face to loft for four
second_commentary: maxwell to gaikwad , 2 wides , tossed up full and down leg , wade didn't collect it cleanly and they snuck through for an extra run

commentary: maxwell to gaikwad , 2 widebowls pretty wide of leg , and very full  gaikwad lets it go , as the ball turns in a bit  they run a single too , after it  a wide ball
second_commentary: maxwell to jaiswal , four , superb shot  tossed up full on outside-off , jaiswal stepped forward , got to the pitch and played a cracking lofted extra-cover-drive , no one out on the off-side and away it went

commentary: maxwell to gaikwad , 2 widebowls pretty wide of leg , and very full  gaikwad lets it go , as the ball turns in a bit  they run a single too , after it  a wide ball
second_commentary: maxwell to gaikwad , 2 wides , tossed up full and down leg , wade didn't collect it cleanly and they snuck through for an extra run

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , no runah , that was close  jaiswal got across the stumps early to try and scoop this length ball , but was beaten  the ball ended up going just over the stumps though
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , no run , jaiswal gets adventurous , was a length delivery on outside-off , jaiswal shuffled across his stumps looking to scoop that over the keeper and didn't lay bat on it

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , no runplays a late cut at this good-length ball , which is shaping away to finish around sixth stump  but the ball goes on the bounce to the man standing at backward-point
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , no run , length delivery slanting across outside-off , jaiswal cut it nicely but couldn't beat point

commentary: ellis to gaikwad ,  1 runchange of pace , as ellis goes full and in the channel outside-off  poked behind point for a single
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , 1 run , full on outside-off , was pace off , gaikwad stabbed it towards backward-point and they crossed across for a quick single

commentary: ellis to gaikwad , no runyorker length on middle and off , and flicked to midwicket  jaiswal wanted a single but was sent back , even as inglis' throw was wide of the stumps
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , no run , pitched up full and straight on middle , clipped straight to mid-wicket

commentary: ellis to gaikwad , no runyorker length on middle and off , and flicked to midwicket  jaiswal wanted a single but was sent back , even as inglis' throw was wide of the stumps
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , wide , full and just sliding down leg with the angle

commentary: ellis to gaikwad , 1 widepitches just outside leg , and darts down further after landing on the fuller side of a length  he looked to flick but missed , and it  called wide
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , no run , pitched up full and straight on middle , clipped straight to mid-wicket

commentary: ellis to gaikwad , 1 widepitches just outside leg , and darts down further after landing on the fuller side of a length  he looked to flick but missed , and it  called wide
second_commentary: nathan ellis to gaikwad , wide , full and just sliding down leg with the angle

commentary: ellis to jaiswal ,  1 runah , ellis leaps to his left with his left hand outstretched , but the ball is beyond him  jaiswal looked to push hard at this length ball , but ended up chipping it towards mid-on , who threw wide at the non-striker  end
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , 1 run , stops on him agian , good length delivery on outside-off , jaiswal looked to push it back down the ground and it lobbed up to nathan ellis' left off the inner half , he leaped to his left but couldn't get it

commentary: ellis to jaiswal , no runbunts at this length ball , which angles across and finishes pretty wide of off  the ball trickles towards mid-off , as jaiswal plays far away from his body
second_commentary: nathan ellis to jaiswal , no run , full outside-off , jaiswal looked to drive through extra-cover , went towards mid-off off the inner half of the blade , that didn't quite come on to the bat

commentary: stoinis to gaikwad , 2 leg byesthis stays slightly low off a short of a length - uneven bounce was talked about too at the pitch report - as the ball finishes on his pads around leg-stump while he attempts to swipe  but the ball ends up rolling behind the wicket for two leg byes
second_commentary: stoinis to gaikwad , leg byes , 2 runs , short of length and attacking the pads , gaikwad looked to pull and was cramped for room and beaten for pace , ended up hitting him on the thigh-pad before going towards backward-square-leg

commentary: stoinis to jaiswal ,  1 runanother shortish delivery - this time around leg  pulled hard to fine-leg
second_commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , 1 run , short of length on middle , pulled away towards deep backward-square-leg , looked like it stopped on him just a touch

commentary: stoinis to jaiswal ,  1 runanother shortish delivery - this time around leg  pulled hard to fine-leg
second_commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , wide , full and shaping down leg , wade has to dive full length to his right to reel that in

commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , 1 wideslower ball , but entirely off his line  bowls this on the fuller side of a length another one and a half set of stumps outside leg - jaiswal even thinks of a swing before he misses - and wade dives to collect it  wide called
second_commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , 1 run , short of length on middle , pulled away towards deep backward-square-leg , looked like it stopped on him just a touch

commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , 1 wideslower ball , but entirely off his line  bowls this on the fuller side of a length another one and a half set of stumps outside leg - jaiswal even thinks of a swing before he misses - and wade dives to collect it  wide called
second_commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , wide , full and shaping down leg , wade has to dive full length to his right to reel that in

commentary: stoinis to gaikwad ,  1 runon a few bounces to the man at fine-leg , who takes a few steps to his left to collect that  on a short of a length around off , as gaikwad swivelled to pull it high
second_commentary: stoinis to gaikwad , 1 run , short of length on middle , short-arm jabbed towards deep backward-square-leg , fielder takes it on the bounce

commentary: stoinis to gaikwad , four runsleans into the drive to bisect the gap between extra-cover and cover  presents the full face of the bat at this length ball shaping away to end around seventh stump , as the ball teases inglis from cover all the way back
second_commentary: stoinis to gaikwad , four , oh that'll feel amazing  pitched up full just outside-off , gaikwad pressed forward , got his weight moving into the ball nicely and punched that with sublime timing through cover , found the gap as well and it beat the fielder to the fence

commentary: stoinis to jaiswal ,  1 runthere is a deep backward-point early on for jaiswal , and he guides this short of a length ball around off stump to the man there  he almost seemed to be cramped for room on this ball
second_commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , 1 run , just short of length on outside-off , jaiswal says leg-side and cuts it away towards deep-point

commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , no runah , some swing right away  this was angled across , but swung back in and landed on a length on middle-stump  jaiswal nudged it to mid-onsee all photos
second_commentary: stoinis to jaiswal , no run , full and straight on middle , hint of swing back in , pushed towards mid-on
